text: #CloseTheGap HIV is not a death sentence. It's preventable and treatable. With antiretroviral therapy (ARVs), the virus can be suppressed to an undetectable level — meaning it can’t be transmitted to others. Start treatment early. Stay on it and live a full, healthy life. https://t.co/6c9Vs9TN5g
author: Foster Mohale

text: #CloseTheGap Some people are still finding it hard to stay on their HIV  treatment, even with the one-pill-a-day option. If you're having a problem, talk to your healthcare provider — help is available. 💊🩺 https://t.co/hZR2Vci2Yd
author: Foster Mohale

Bilateral meeting between SA Minister Dr Joe Phaahla and his Cuban counterpart on the sidelines on 2022 World Health Assembly. Cuba and SA have a longstanding history of cooperation in health. @HealthZA @SpotlightNSP @dailymaverick @GautengHealth https://t.co/WMWXmVTXXy
author: Foster Mohale

text: The Minister of Health, Dr Joe Phaahla addressing the World Health Assembly in Geneva -Switzerland on South Africa's Country intervention on the response to the WHO Director-General's report. Tuesday, 24 May 2022!! @HealthZA @WHOSouthAfrica @ https://t.co/ppRKY04ynm
author: Foster Mohale

text:
#VaccinateToSaveSouthAfrica #KeReady :A second dose of the J& J vaccine protects people from hospitalisation and ICU admission by up to 82% in the first two months after the second dose, compared to unvaccinated populations.

https://t.co/q7kdDNAczw
author: Foster Mohale

text: #Keready #Selfcare #Papsmear #HPVvaccination #ichoosevaccination #vaccinessavelives #vaccinated #vaccinatetosavesouthafrica #vaccineswork : Self care also means being proactive with your health. Zinakekele! https://t.co/6H3bUuW5EL
author: Foster Mohale

text: #keready #letstalkvax: Join the young medical doctors as they lead the discussion around the vaccine  benefits in protecting the lives and the livelihoods, the myths around vaccine and sex drive effects of vaccine. @eNCA @HealthZA https://t.co/WALQkpraLl
author: Foster Mohale

text: #InternationalNursesDay2022 : Health Minister Dr Joe Phaahla commemorated the International Nurses Day with Steve Biko Academic Hospital Nurses and paid tribute to fallen heroes and heroines who passed on while saving lives. @HealthZA @GautengHealth @DENOSAORG @eNCA @miamalan https://t.co/1UNNw0mAFP
author: Foster Mohale

text: #InternationalNursesDay2022 : Health Minister Dr Joe Phaahla joined the nurses Steve Biko Academic Hospital, Tshwane to commemorate international nurses day to recognise the dedication and sacrifices made by nurses. Minister Phaahla also.paid tribute to fallen heroes and heroines https://t.co/EwMQLlPOSA
author: Foster Mohale

text: @eNCA The Afriforum is challenging the government's efforts to save lives and the livelihoods, especially when the country is on the verge of the 5th wave. They should channel their resources and energies to encourage ppl to vaccinate.
author: Foster Mohale

text: @Thethelwa3 @MorningLiveSABC @HealthZA Side effects or adverse events following immunisation doesn't mean vaccine has expired, we will never deliver vaccine which is about to expire to vaccination site,
author: Foster Mohale

text: Minister of Health, Dr Phaahla has announced an extension on the submission deadline for public comments on the health regulations meant to manage COVID-19 and other notifiable conditions outside the state of disaster. The new submission deadline is Sunday, 24 April 2022. https://t.co/4Ph9VPnwhS
author: Foster Mohale

text:
Stay woke young kings & queens🤘🏾
Flu Season is coming!
Get your flu vaccine and your Covid vaccine or booster at the same time.

text: #ReturnToPaly #KeReady: The long awaited moment for sports-loving-fans to reunite with their players and athletes is here. It comes with a package of vaccination. Get yourself a life-saving jab, download your certificate and bring a proof of identity. @kereadysa @HealthZA https://t.co/EVyTGj7V1y
author: Foster Mohale

text: #ReturnToPlay #Kenedy: Mzansi, are you vaccinated? If, yes, buy your ticket and bring your proof of vaccination and identity document. If, not vaccinated yet, vaccination teams will assist you, arrive early to avoid missing the game. @PhophiRamathuba @kereadysa @GautengHealth https://t.co/F6DBCuDaYk
author: Foster Mohale

text:

text: #Keready #VaccinatetosaveSA: Booster shots are unavoidable during this period of the pandemic for fully vaccinated people as the primary doses tend to wane over time. Health Deputy Minister Dr Sibongiseni Dhlomo has boosted his immunity against Covid-19.@HealthZA https://t.co/SpxQVMz4GL
author: Foster Mohale

text: #Keready #BoosterShot : Health Deputy Minister Dr Sibongiseni boosting his immunity against Covid-19. Booster doses are the same vaccine in the same dose administered to people who have had a primary vaccination series @HealthZA @KanyaNdaki @PhophiRamathuba @bonglez @HeidiGiokos https://t.co/Rmsyiw9gfu
author: Foster Mohale

text: #KeReady #VaccinateToSaveSA @HealthZA https://t.co/b9lG186MOk
author: Foster Mohale

text: @MASTA_KING @HealthZA Vaccine benefits outweigh risks despite few reported side effects. Otherwise majority of vaccinated ppl would have died. Approved Covid-19 vaccines provide a high degree of protection against getting seriously ill and dying from the disease, however NO vaccine is 100% protective
author: Foster Mohale

text: @MASTA_KING @HealthZA All vaccines and medicines have side effects, with majority of Covid-19 vaccine side effects being monitored and resolving within 2-3 days. Individuals respond differently to vaccination and side effects differ slightly.
author: Foster Mohale

text: #VaccineSideEffects: People who experience side effects or adverse events following immunisation are urged to immediately report to the nearest health facility or vaccination site, OR you can call COVID-19 hotline on 0800 029999. Side effects are taken seriously. @HealthZA
author: Foster Mohale

text: @Rowley57S @bonglez @HealthZA @GCISMedia @WHOSouthAfrica @dailymaverick @miamalan Vaccinate so we continue to report zero deaths, fewer infection cases, higher recovery rates, relieve pressure from our hardworking healthcare workers, faster economic recovery, lift restrictions, save lives and live hoods, and so forth and so forth
author: Foster Mohale

text: #VaccinateToSaveSouthAfrica #KeReady: For the 2nd time since May 2020, South Africa has recorded zero Covid-19-related deaths in a 24-hour cycle.  We can continue to save more lives through vaccination. @HealthZA @GCISMedia @WHOSouthAfrica @dailymaverick @bonglez @miamalan https://t.co/TjO2ZJr9aG
author: Foster Mohale

text: #vaccinatetosavesouthafrica  #Keready : Join hands with the patriotic South Africans to fight the enemy called Covid-19 pandemic, get yourself a free weapon of mass destruction called Covid-19 vaccine dose of your choice today. The battle continues, no surrender no retreat. https://t.co/X1UWgViKxu

text: @_HassanF @HealthZA @PresidencyZA @GovernmentZA The issue of negative PRC test results applies to all incoming travellers, local citizens returning SA or visitors. This has nothing to do with nationality, we protect the country against transmission of the virus to save lives of all ppl who live in our country.
author: Foster Mohale

text: #VaccinateToSaveSA #KeReady: Do the right thing to achieve good life. Good life begins with protecting yourself against COVID-19 pandemic & other diseases. Good health begins with regular health screening and testing. @HealthZA @HeidiGiokos @KanyaNdaki @PhophiRamathuba @miamalan https://t.co/f3k5gt7trL
author: Foster Mohale

text: #VaccinateToSaveSouthAfrica: Get vaccinated! Protect yourself. The first & most powerful tool we have against COVID-19 is vaccination,  it is by far the most important way to protect us against severe illness, hospitalisation or death in the event we contract the coronavirus. https://t.co/L0TLIOlZdi
author: Foster Mohale

text: #VaccineSavesLives: When the fourth wave came in, there was a rise in Covid-19 vaccine uptake. But the more people hear that this is not so deadly, that people are surviving and staying for shorter periods in hospital, the uptake decreased. https://t.co/cfdEI1CUhC
author: Foster Mohale

text: @notirkedbyyou The late Zimbabwean liberator and one of the few known most academically achieved heads of state, RG Mugabe once said, "Let's not ignore the truth as we move foward". So it would be reckless for the govt to take COVID-19 decisions based on the loudest noise instead of science.
author: Foster Mohale

text: Let's listen to the experts now like we did before when COVID-19 was ravaging like wild fieldfire & stop politicizing this deadly & non-discriminating disease. Let's not gamble with the lives of our people for Political reasons. COVID-19 is still here, one death is too many. https://t.co/6WvCAdZFlR
author: Foster Mohale

text: @Travispaliyath1 @Abramjee @GautengHealth @HealthTshwane @HealthZA @DDMabuza @David_Makhura We are going towards that direction, once we are satisfied with the impact of Covid-19 Drive Through Vaccination, Covid-19 Test-Through will be piloted. Now we urge everyone, unvaccinated and partly vaccinated, to do the right thing to have a safer, happier festive period.
author: Foster Mohale

text: @TlotlisoM_ @HajraOmarjee @VaxChampsSA @businessforsa @HealthZA @CyrilRamaphosa @TlotlisoM_, the position of ACDP on this life-saving treatment is written on the bus, we can't blame you for asking all these questions, it is not you, you are a messenger,  you are caught between science and religion, please liberate yourself.

text: @Newzroom405 The vaccination journey is incomplete until you get the second dose of two-dose Covid-19 vaccine.  This is tantamount to treatment defaulting. Let's advise our loved ones, friends, relatives, colleagues and fellow community members to do the right thing - get the 2nd dose.
author: Foster Mohale

text:
#VaccinateToSaveSouthAfrica: 2 714 560 (over 2,7 million) digital COVID-19 vaccination certificates have been downloaded by 17h00, Tuesday, 26 October 2021. Join the movement to save lives and livelihoods. VAKSINEIT 2DEY
@HealthZA @miamalan @KanyaNdaki @HeidiGiokos @bonglez
author: Foster Mohale

text: #VaccinateToSaveSouthAfrica: It's our responsibility as responsible parents to responsibly protect our children against deadly & non-discriminating pandemic. Protect the children, prectect the future of SA.@HealthZA @miamalan @KanyaNdaki @WHOSouthAfrica @HeidiGiokos @bonglez
